Entry.1: Very windy wet & cold 3 Taubes over no damage
Entry.2: In camp very cold & miserable day very quiet
Entry.4: Similar to 3rd & NZ. Moved to El Arish from 139 K.
Entry.5: In Camp Railway reached El. Arish from Kantara distance 154 K
Entry.6: General visit Brigades Taube over no damage
Entry.8: Battle of Rafa heavy fighting all day captured 1600 prisoners 7 guns & 4 machine guns
Entry.17: Fine day lat sleep and work
Entry.18: Very rough Sea our Aeroplanes very busy flying overhead
Entry.20: Routine Camp Work very windy and dusty
Entry.21: Left with General Sir H Chauvel for Cairo on Duty. Travelled all day until midnight when we reached Cairo
Entry.22:
visited Base made arrangements to have allot stopped from 1 March

Spent in Cairo Had Photo taken
Entry.23: Duty in Cairo visited Major Foster in 14th General Hospital
Entry.25: Left Cairo 6 pm for El Arish
Entry.26:
Arrived El Arish 11 am Very tired and sleepy

Received letter from Gladys. Very happy
Entry.27:
Taubes over dropping bombs. Very hazy day. Difficult to locate aeroplanes. 

Rum Issue
Entry.28:
Dug a Funk Hole Taube over dropping bombs visited the 7 wells

Got Loused
Entry.29: Digging Funk Hole Taubes over. No damage visited 1st Brigade wrote letter to G.
Entry.30: very windy & dusty Taubes over observing visited D.C.H. Rum Issue
Entry.31: Fine day. Usual camp work. Getting very monotonous
Entry.32:
Taube over nearly dropped with well directed shot mine exploded near pier

Very quiet day
Entry.34: L H Bgde General inspected Brigade Taube over moved A.Air C. guns up the Waaddi Rum !
Entry.35: Usual Camp work very fine weather
Entry.36: Visited Auckland Regt at 7 wells. Also Headqrs Camel Corps. Flies very bad
Entry.37: Very fine day. 2nd Bgde moved from Mazar to El Arish saw Ted Grace from Kantarah. Rum Issue
Entry.38:
Drops of rain very cold 1st Brigade moved back to Bayond. Auckland & Canterbury football A scoreless match Anxiously awaiting Aus. Mail

Jacko’s airmen have forgotten to visit us
Entry.39: Visited old Regt old mates in great spirits had tea with them also saw C Squadron playing football. Very much like rain thunder & lighting something awful. Hope we do not get a wet skin General Chetwode & Chauvel inspected
Entry.40: Brigade in morning afternoon played football between C Squadron
Entry.41:
L H & Wellington Regt A scoreless draw got wet to the skin going home anxiously awaiting Aus mail Taube over observing Received Gift from Lady Mayoress Melbourne had great feed. Very quiet day cleaning gear and mending clothes Rum Issue

Waadi in Flood Train delayed
Entry.42: Australian mail arrived letters from G & N. very worried. Great game of Football between Auckland & Wellington Regt A scoreless draw. Fine weather very much like an Australian spring day.
Entry.43: Very cold day little rain 10 Aeroplanes went out to bomb Jacko. Pay day. Wrote to G. & N. also sent P.C. Sky very black thoughts of another wet skin
Entry.44: Very cold day showery Peter & Andy gone to join 2nd M. Div Rum Issue Had a easy day mostly reading and day dreaming of home and one I.L
Entry.45:
Very fine day match between Australia & New Zealand 6 to Nil 

Saw all old boys in Squadron
Entry.46:
Very quiet day. G. visited Magdhara. Beautiful weather. Taube sighted

a good many of our machines out Bombing
Entry.47: Very fine weather great activities in camp getting ready to move to Rafa
Entry.49: G Chetwode & Chauvel visited 22nd B. very hot afternoon pulling down bivouacs and packing up moving off at 7.30 am 22nd
Entry.50:
Moved to Sheikh Zawaied as we were going along beach a Taube was over observing travelled all day reached Sheikh about 4 pm tired & dusty very fine country en route was warned for picquet as soon as we reached camp

2nd B & NZ. B. moved to Rafa where they engaged the enemy

gave horses feed of green barley
Entry.51:
Fixing a temporary camp in Hod 2nd NZ Bgde arrived back from Rafa they drove Turks out of their front line trenches our casualties were very slight 

53 inf arrived expect a big go in a few weeks our camp is crawling with Camel ticks I have been scratching like Hell

 Rum Issue
Entry.52: Taubs over observing no bombs had Mike out grazing Turks occupied Rafa 2nd Bgd moving out to keep in touch
Entry.53: Mike very bad green feed did not agree with him General Dobell Chetwode & Chauvel visited front line tenches otherwise very quiet
Entry.54: Letters from G & N. Taubes over Loveredge knocked by mule Harry Cook landed 2nd Bgde stunted to Rafa Railway passed camp Duchess went gay 6 Prisoners
Entry.55: Rained like Hell Son & myself got wet to the skin up at 3
Entry.56: Bgde met Turkish Cavalry. Rum Issue Q M arrived drunk Miller & Shean had a box on more Turks
Entry.57: Horses out in the crops Taubes over General went to Rafa more Turks
Entry.58:
Pay Day

Generals Murray Dobell Chetwode Chauvel visited front Line Galloped like Hell Taube over in dozens to protect G Murray Taube over just as G.M. arrived
Entry.59:
Taube over General Chetwode & Chauvel visited Rafa Tommie Generals beggars to Gallop. Mike got a hiding General visited tent camp 

2nd Bgde captured 6 snipers Big Gun opened on them Rum Issue very small
Entry.60: Moved camp from Sheikh Zawaied to the beach near the Med. Had a hard day shifting and lugging bivvie Taubes over Air Craft Guns arrived to night Mike very bad with colic Cigarette issue.
Entry.61: Very cloudy little rain Taube over & brought down at Rafa Patrols in action General left for Rafa with armoured cars very cold & rain Looking forward to a move
Entry.62: Very slow day very lazy and sleeping throughout the day. Turks returning Rum Issue
Entry.63: Had a trip to Rafa with General returning in the evening Inspected two aeroplanes Niggers very scared of them The airmen were throwing signal bombs at them and they were going like Hell
Entry.64: Taube over early flying very low 2nd Bgde moved 2 miles up the beach Turks retired about 12 miles
Entry.65: Taube over flying very low Twelve of our planes went out to bomb Jacko who is still retreating Rum Issue General had a day in
Entry.66: Broke Camp at 10.30 to move 7 miles up the beach very desolate and bleak. Worked like niggers to erect bivvies. Water a great drawback can only move short distances. Jacko still retiring Taubes over about 5.30 flying very low Anxiously awaiting Aus mail. NZ moved with us
Entry.67: Bivvie down during the night blowing like Hell Covered with sand when I woke
Entry.68: Bivvie down again pouring rain wet to the bone buggar of a day blowing awful Taubes over Son back from Cairo started to train B
Entry.69: Had Baldy out 4 a.m working otherwise very quiet Taubes over in morning
Entry.70: Baldy out with Boxer B going well Taubes over Australian mail arrived Rum Issue
Entry.71: Taubes over very quiet day Turkish Lancers sighted by our Patrols
Entry.72: Taubes over in morning getting very hot usual routine
Entry.73:
M

N.Z. had an engagement with Turkish Lancers nothing doing Taubes over very hot day
Entry.74: Baldy out hasy day. Very quiet & hot Taubes giving us a spell
Entry.75: Taubes over but dropping no bombs A big move expected
Entry.76: Still working Baldie gave him a good gallop this morning at 4 a.m expect him to win Race Thursday
Entry.77: Race coming off to day. Fine day and big crowd present Baldie ran third in Anzac Steeple. Taubes over not dropping bombs
Entry.78: Taubes over this morning having rest after races moving at any moment for Gaza or Beersheba big battle expected
Entry.79: General went to Gaza Turks holding a strong position surrounding town Taubes over. Waiting 2 hours notice to move to Belah
Entry.80: Very quiet getting ready to move to Gaza Taubes over
Entry.81: Left Rafa 2 a.m Arrived Belah about 4 pm
Entry.83:
Left Belah 2 am to surround Gaza L.H. S.E of Town Infantry attack from coast to our Flank. Taubes flying very low opening with M.G. fire Town surrounded by 9 am 2nd Bgde captures General Staff and privates. Infantry att over very open ground casualties very heavy. Shrapnel like flies Fierce fighting all day N.Z. & 2nd Bgde went into the Turks with fixed bayonets about 4 pm and advanced about 2 miles capturing 360 prisoners and 2 guns 

Our casualties very light got order to retire about 7 pm Turks still in town Cavalry returning to Belah 8000 Turks Reinf attacking our rear
Entry.84: Bgde holding them until we clear out. Very quiet Infantry holding Turks LH holding Flanks big offensive coming off out all day & night from Saturday night at 2 am
Entry.85:
Very quiet Taubes very busy large quantities of stores and ammunition arriving big battle expected any day. First wash for five days very nice 

out all day 2 am to 9 pm
Entry.86: Still waiting Taubes extra busy Tanks arrived at Belah I bet Jacko gets a shock. Waiting for mail Total P to date 629 including G.S. out all day 3 am to 7 pm
Entry.87: Shifted camp about 1 mile great activity big battle expected 60 pounders opened fire to night Turks replied to no affect Aus mail arrived 1 letter from N. no photos yet out all day 3 am to 8 pm
Entry.88: Jacko over flying very low Big guns opened on Turks infantry crossed Wadi out all day
Entry.89:
Taubes very active all day. Had look at the Tanks very complicated 2, 6 pounders 4 M.G & several Hochkiss G. about 32 ft long 15 ft long 

Turks captured from B Inf day of Gaza fight 52 MG. 1 MC. & 8 M
Entry.90: Fierce fighting for two hours on the Front. Heavy bombardment by Turks Aeroplanes very busy 2nd & NZ Bgde were Cinema in the evening also G. Chauvel & staff including myself also a block photo of G.C. staff.
Entry.91: Artillery exchanging shells Taubes very busy otherwise very quiet Orders came out for all Aus ranks to clean all steel gear and Turks not 5 miles away the way the B. win their battles shining gear
Entry.92: Very quiet usual artillery duels and Taubes very busy cleaning all steel gear I cleaned mine with a rasp lost a lot of sweat
Entry.93: Talk of the fight coming off on Sunday hope so Taubes keeping very busy also very hot Aeroplane dropped a bag of mail from prisoners
Entry.94: Enemy very active also Fokkers flying overhead throughout the day An old sailing vessel arrived with a cargo of shells beautiful weather
Entry.95: Visited Khanunue also 1st Brgde Beautiful orchids for miles arrived home at 5 pm enjoyable day
Entry.96: Very quiet Artillery & Fokkers very busy. Thousands of shells arriving per steamer
Entry.97:
Usual Artillery activity Fokkers very busy over our lines for hour or more 

gave chase to one of our machines who steered clear of him
Entry.98: Great preparations large quantities of shells & Guns arriving must be 150,000 men here about 70,000 Turk from all accounts Ariel duel this evening our fellow came out on top Battle expected any day
Entry.99: Captured one of the Turkish Lancers usual Artillery bombardment Fokkers very busy. One of our Airmen killed in duel Battle coming off in a few days anxiously waiting
Entry.100: Very quiet Heavy artillery bombardment and Fokkers very busy Received Gas helmets we are going to use Gas shells
Entry.101:
Turks bombarded our Hospital with 6 in gun for 2 hours They gave notice to result was they mean to shift it

Heavy Artillery duel all day Fokkers very busy dropping bombs fine weather having plenty of sleep I will need it too
Entry.103: very heavy bombardment by Jacko with 6 inch guns niggers going in all directions conference on battle expected in a few days Turks moved up to line buggars don’t know what will be worse H or Gas Artillery & Fokk very busy very hot. Moving out 6.30 all night ride
Entry.104: Moved out at 6.30 16th Dust was that bad could not see the chap in front of you also very cold shivered up a sweat Infantry att Gaza and were repulsed with heavy loss
Entry.105: Recon a T. Position 8 miles east of Shallal terrible hot and dusty leaving for Gaza at 6.30
Entry.106: Travelled all night in Position at dawn terrible bombardment with B. Guns tanks & Gas used Fokkers doing damage with bombs no advance made
Entry.107: travelled until 1 am to 3 miles W of dog tired and very sleepy
Entry.108: moved to new camp about 3 miles W of J. water very scarce General Chauvel left Anzac Div for Desert Column Headqtrs also sent with him
Entry.109: moving again to day to a new camp are amongst the Tommies don’t find them so bad
Entry.110: Camped about 3 miles from Khan Yunus watering there terrible dusty nearly chokes me very quiet on the front Gaza very hard to take
Entry.111: Buggar of a day blowing like Hell from the South. dust to blind a chap. Had a drop of J W. otherwise very quiet
Entry.112: Very hot & dusty first wash for Four days it was great would give a 100 for a long P. went to the beach about 9 miles swam horse longing to have a spell feel done
Entry.113: Terrible hot and dusty wind enough to burn a chap having a fairly easy time on D Column. Chums don’t seem too bad. Very quiet on the front
Entry.114: Very cool day wish for drops of rain had a drop of SJ Fokkers very busy otherwise very quiet with heavy Guns in action
Entry.115: Had a few drops of rain, also very cool otherwise very quiet A few Fokkers over
Entry.116:
Rum Issue

With General on joy ride beautiful weather Albo over about Sundown shot fired at him.
Entry.117: Very quiet & beautiful weather light rain also Canteen grub. An Albo. over with two Bristols in pursuit Bridge on to night
Entry.118: Had a trip to Beach gave horses a dip very rough Artillery active on both sides also Albos.
Entry.119: Big guns going some also Albos very warm and Flies would carry a chap away
Entry.120: Having a very easy time G using motor giving horse a spell a – of a camp flies are terrible. Albos are very constant in their visits Heavy artillery duel
Entry.121: Getting on tip top with the chums an easy day on our backs giving our common enemy some hurry up Heavy guns pouring shells into Gaza Federal Elections Eggs for dinner (half bad)
Entry.122:
Very quiet 2 E nearly knocked me over nearly touched earth Jacko bombed Hell out of us last night dropped about 40 bombs and played his M.G. on We are returning combatments to night 

Living like fighting cocks camped near canteen
Entry.123: Usual Aero & Artillery duel bad flies would drive a chap mad Jacko reported very strong likely to be here some time
Entry.124: Very hot and dusty Albos over all day and bombed hell out of us at night most Hospit or casualty
Entry.125: No change on front usual artillery activity and Albos over also bombed us throughout the night
Entry.126: Very quiet on front usual artillery duels Bgde on stunt Albos over all day and during night bombed Hell out of us at 9 & 2 o’clock
Entry.127:
As usual on front with Aeroplanes very busy with bombs Aus mail in

letter from D. N.G. also writing all lights out at night
Entry.128:
not feeling too well had a terrible job to finish letters Usual on front

large quantities of stores being removed back. Big attack expected
Entry.129: Usual on front Artillery very active two Divisions arrived and camped at Khan Yunus Keeping very warm and dusty
Entry.130: Keeping very quiet no sign of a move
Entry.131: Getting very monotonous nothing but fight flies and eat dust Batt of Indians came in for a rest
Entry.132:
Very quiet no sign of a move feeling very queer had a great night JWs

Very cold evenings
Entry.133: As usual Alba over dropping small bombs still visiting Hospital chance of a trip tip in camp war over by June 30
Entry.134:
Aeroplanes and Artillery very busy. Went for a ride in the 

Had a few apricots very hot and dusty & about fed up
Entry.135:
M ay

Heat terrible and flies – very quiet day. Laying about eating flies Mackenson no sign of a move reported here
Entry.136:
A terrible day. Dust a treat all day. Could not see 50 yds and not a drop of water to have a wash I got the horse brush and brushed myself 

All appearances of keeping up all night
Entry.137: Awful night got smothered in dust could not see when I got up don’t want to experience another like it
Entry.138: still blowing hard all day with dust the same give me the desert Very hot and dust bad our New Planes very busy. Good news from France
Entry.139:
Getting warmer as days go by. and flies they are thriving simply eat a chap 

Very good shooting at Jacko with Air craft French Gunners
Entry.140: Took horses to Shellal waited until lunch then moved back to Bens’ The AMD blew 8 miles of railway and destroyed a
Entry.141: Very hot and dusty cleaning gear aeroplanes very busy. Otherwise on front very quiet
Entry.142: Very quiet went to DADOS with White Taubes very busy also Artillery Aus mail arrived
Entry.143: Usual activity in the air General visited the whole of the front line Getting warm and dustier The natives are still harvesting
Entry.144: A day of rest and beautiful weather
Entry.145: Anzac Div relieved by IMD camped near Khan Yunus Great air duel in evening Taube drove one of our machines to earth
Entry.146: Very quiet and very dusty nothing doing on the front Aircraft very busy
Entry.147: Usual quietness Aeroplanes very busy. Feeling very seedy want a change
Entry.148: Nothing doing on the front. Aerial activity no sign of a move must be waiting for Jacko to attack
Entry.149: General visited line 15 South of Fara in sight of Beersheba great activity in air one Taube forced down
Entry.150: Artillery duel through out the day. Taube forced down at Rafa machine intact also pilot & observer our chaps after Jacko when he shows out
Entry.151: Taube forced down on the beach very hot feeling below zero
Entry.152:
Jacko dropping bombs very little damage also great air duel. 

 from Ada also L. thinks the world of it Very quiet on the front
Entry.153: Going like hell not a moment to spare Very quiet in trenches very heavy bomb Taubes very active dropping bombs.
Entry.154: Still travelling some early morning until dark cannot find time to write a line Getting very warm usual activity in the air Three enemy machines brought down in one week
Entry.155: Still going wondering when it is going to cease too tired to do anything Usual on front
Entry.156: Very quiet day. Although Aeroplanes had a duel or two Leaving for Cairo on duty
Entry.157: Arrived in Cairo at 5.30. very tired and sleepy
Entry.158: Still in Cairo having a good time
Entry.167: Before orderly room being absent without leave returning to Moascar
Entry.168: Arrived Moascar met all the old boys Are returning to the Regiment
Entry.193: Arrived at Rafa went into Detail camp for 24 hours
Entry.194: Left Rafa for Regt at Tel-el-Fara arrived at 2300
Entry.195: Left Fara for outpost line 5 miles north W. for one weeks duty in trenches and patrols 5 miles to water horses
Entry.196: Usual work man redoubt at night and also five night patrols
Entry.197: Horses out all day water at Waidi at 8. then graze G of W. until 2.30 watering then return to camp
Entry.198: Same old routine trenches at night etc stand to at 3.30 until 5 am
Entry.199: Still no change in work Stand to is a killer Wishing we were out of it
Entry.200: Leaving to morrow for old camp at Fara
Entry.201: 1st Regt 1 L.H. B returned us this morning we are returning to camp N of Fara leaving at 2 am on a stunt with
Entry.202: out all day. but nothing doing returned to camp about sunset
Entry.203: Resting all day Leaving at 6 pm for W.Imlay
Entry.205:
Left at 6 pm for W.Imlay making for rear of Turks lines our troop was surrounded by T for 2 hours horses 1½ m away A.S. went 2 miles further 

Ran into 2 Batts of Turks we withdrew safely and reached camp at 6.30 am. very tired and as red as Berries Doing 24 hours water Guard at Shellal mounting at 4.30
Entry.206: Very easy Guard at Water. relieved at 6.30. Regiment marched out laying cable to Khan back at 12 night
Entry.207:
Very lazy all day. Leaving for at 6 pm about 16 miles

5th Reg carrying out stunt we took out post on W. Imlay cold as charity left W. at 4 am for Fara
Entry.208: Very sleepy and tired having a good old sleep
Entry.209: Ted Sedgwick went to church having a great joke with him
Entry.210: Usual stunt to hurry Jacko up
Entry.211: Out all day. arrived back late in the evening
Entry.212: Having a quiet day a few fatigues and very windy and dusty
Entry.213: Leaving for another stunt. out all night
Entry.214: Arrived back in the morning very tired getting plenty of work
Entry.217: Arrived back in camp at 7 going to blow them out
Entry.218: A day of rest and I am going to make the most of it
Entry.219: Leaving far a stunt at 2 am going to take a line near Jackos redoubt
Entry.220: Taking line 600 yds Jacko very warm laying out no cover Lieut Tim Black our troop leader seriously wounded
Entry.221: Having a quiet day Arrived back from Post 8 am Tim Black died wounds at Rafa
Entry.222: Leaving for Beach for a good spell relieved by Tommies
Entry.223: Having a great time here plenty of surf
Entry.224: Transport driver had a go with the Gippos shots exchanged also
Entry.225: Having a great time eat sleep and loaf
Entry.229: Boxing tourney opened to night some very fights a good nights amusement old Brig Ref
Entry.241:
First rain in Palestine Beach

Wrote to Jack White to apply for Furlough for myself
Entry.243:
Gibbs of 7 gave trial scene from Merchant of Venice

Beach Concert in YMCA
Entry.251: Left beach for Aba-San 2 miles to water Dust awful
Entry.252: Blowing like the devil usual dust
Entry.253: Talk of having night alarms not too pleasant usual dust storms
Entry.254: not so dusty as other days Certain we will be called out to night 15 min to have all ready
Entry.255: Fine weather heavy Guns moving to right Flank
Entry.256:
Very quiet Playing football Fine weather Football match 

Going on 24 hrs Guard
Entry.257: Beautiful weather Guard throughout day. Inspection of Regt by B. Major
Entry.259: Silly buggar stunt about 6 miles south of camp I was in the artillery
Entry.260: General Allenby inspected horses of Division
Entry.263: C Squadron played G Sqd Football a scoreless draw very dusty
Entry.264: Very dusty a couple of Taubes over talk of a big move
Entry.265: A & B Sqd Played a draw Four Taubes over in the morning still very dusty and rain seems near
Entry.266: A hurry up turn out everybody in Fatigue dress moved out ready for action in 30 minutes inspected by M Gen
Entry.267: Football in chaps are getting some nasty knocks very rough
Entry.268: 7 & 5th LH played a hard game 3 all
Entry.271: Still very dusty having a fairly easy time
Entry.272: 7 & 6 LH played a very good game 3 all points for 7th
Entry.273:
D. went to Rafa to put cross of Lt Blacks grave 

Capt Steele brought down an Albatros Scout both pilot & machine uninjured
Entry.274: Very dusty but it is the usual every day
Entry.275:
Still blowing like Hades very little to do Sham fighting near Rafa Sort of rehearsal

14 Sun 

Very quiet

15 Mon

3rd & 4th Sqd team had a very funny match
Entry.276: won by 3 Arrival of beer very little sold more water than hops
Entry.277: Another Albatros brought down by Capt Steele machine smashed to atoms pilot killed. Plenty of fatigues 1st &
Entry.279: Had a great night getting plenty from the Sergts very dusty
Entry.280: Talking of leaving for front great activity on Railways Shells by the thousand arriving
Entry.281: Nothing doing yet very windy and dusty
Entry.282: Still nothing and usual dust Had great time on Perf the joke of the camp
Entry.283: Left Abbasan for Esani Esani early morning
Entry.284:
Fatigues to burn making roads in the Wadi and digging wells 
Birthday
Entry.286: Leaving at 5 for Aziz on Beersheba line passed through Khallasa about 10 reached Esani small
Entry.287:
to 27 Sat 

Arrived Aziz Wells in terrible state Turks before leaving blew them in outpost all night and as soon as we came off told off to clean wells out worked from 6 until 12 pick & shovel had 6 hours off and went on for another 4 hours a bit tough on Bully & Biscuits but we are doing our best horses have not had water for 42 hours every sign of them having a drink in the morning. Turks are a few miles out our Patrols are in touch the Big move expected any day We are still on the wells and are getting them into shape although there is not much water
Entry.288: General Allenby was out to inspect the well he was very pleased with the work done
Entry.289:
We are getting sick of the work on the rations 4 on and 8 off on B & B and there is no 

Prince of Morocco arrived at Asluj Fine old chap Minister of Foreign Affairs with him.
Entry.290: Leaving to night form Beersheba attack to be launched at 10 am
Entry.291: Travelled all night in Pos 5 miles W of Beer at 10.30 on Hebron Road Heavy Bombardment all day 4th Brigade attacked at 10 pm capturing the whole of the town and 1000
Entry.292: Moved about 3 miles further W Turks returning towards Gaza having a bad time for rations
Entry.293: Outpost night moved on to a Turk position about 9 am met opposition Cpl Thompson killed Snipers very active and good shots occupied hills day
Entry.294: Outpost night still occupied with enemy 9,000 prisoners 80 guns heavy fighting on our left dog tired and sleepy
Entry.295: Outpost night still in touch enemy
Entry.296: Dug position at 3 pm still in same position heavy fighting on our left
Entry.297: Left for Beersheba for water 12 miles M.G. Sect & Composite Regt left to guard Flank 32 Casualties arrived Beer 12.30 Watered and left for Sheria at 6 pm
Entry.298: Arrived Sheria early morning relieved Yeomanry Infantry broke line and drove back 8 miles Anzac Mtd Div 1st & 2nd Bgds took up the running Turks for all they are worth
Entry.299:
Prisoners by the hundreds also Battery of Guns millions of rounds of ammunition Shells by the stacks Advanced about 4 miles during the day 

Jacko giving us plenty of shells
Entry.300: Still in pursuit of Jacko who is burning as he goes Water is scarce at present C. Troop position with plenty of water Casualties not too heavy
Entry.301: Still after the Brown chap who is going for his life we are holding about 17 miles of Beersheba Jerusalem Railway Very big post in Turks lines more stores being burnt Lack of men more prisoners
Entry.302: Moved from got into Camp at
Entry.303: Moved to a camp near beach standing to have travelled 200 miles to date Casualties very heavy
Entry.304: Chasing Jacko in beautiful country nearing fine villages and Natives can speak English mostly German Jews
Entry.305: On the Right Flank about 20 miles from Jerusalem very rough and stoney Jacko still retiring Taubes are conspicuous by their absence
Entry.306: SarronaRailway Junction captured for Jaffa Jerusalem and Beersheba Rolling stock and guns on trucks captured 460 prisoners and Turkish Hospital full of wounded
Entry.307:
and 17 Sat

Passed through a fine village natives speak good English bought bread and oranges very dear Jacko still retiring Sleeping with boots off first time for 17 days about 14 miles from Jaffa Left for position about 8 miles south of Jaffa relieving
Entry.308: Brigade Jacko still about 24 miles our front
Entry.310: Watered our horses at a German Settlement Wilhelmia mostly women and children they do not seem too friendly but make the most of it There is a fine avenue of Gum trees growing through the centre of village The place boasts Hotel two storyes The eatables are very dear eggs p1 each Butter 3/- lb and other articles at ruling prices wine is cheap
Entry.311:
We are doing Patrols and outposts around the Settlements still in touch with Jacko We do not know how we are going on in 

22 Th

Our Regt is attached to 54 Div doing Patrols & Recon do not know how long we are likely to remain with them. We are getting tired of it all have not had a chance to write a letter since
Entry.312: and do not know how long will be before we have the pleasure.
Entry.313: Doing patrols for 54 Div heavy shell fire on our right do not know if Jerusalem has fallen The is charging 4f for Butter and 5f for honey paying with a smile
Entry.314:
Early morning Patrol 4 am Jacko still in the Hills with M.G. opened on us heavy fire We can shift him at any moment Rumours he is going to counter attack I hope he does if so we 

DEC
Entry.315: very quiet day visited Jaffa very dirty place very fine buildings
Entry.316: Stunt to night raiding Jacko trenches at 8 pm We started all right but our infantry artillery put barrage on us so we suffered 2K & 21 W including myself
Entry.317: Passed through Jaffa Ramleh on way to 14 AGH Just a nice wound bullet still in arm giving a little pain
Entry.318: Rejoined unit near Jaffa Going into trenches to night Plenty of shells thrown at us today luckily no casualties
Entry.319: Took one line of trenches at dusk. Very Jacko about 400 yds on our front Horses left in rear with spare man Trenches are awful too narrow we dare not move in case of shell and sniper We do 24 hours in trenches
Entry.320: We and Cavalry took a line of trenches but could not hold them enemy too strong. He shelled us for hours and they were simply raining. We withdrew about 600 yds still in trenches cannot move or show ourselves we are isolated until dark
Entry.321:
In support at night digging at 4 am. 7th Regt captured 147 men 2 MG 200 Rifles Jacko tried to dig in too close Heavy shell fire all day We had 9 casualties trying to raid a Jacko post

NOVEMBER 25, 26, 27, 28
Entry.323: Jacko counter attacked the line held by A.M.D. heavy casualties inflicted on him We were recalled from the 54th Div Reached old camp with 54th erley sign of a counter attack by Jacko
Entry.324:
and 5 Wed

Stand to 4 am left to Patrol to Jackos line met heavy fire 1 mile E of Railway Station Jacko advancing along R line about 4,000 we engaged enemy for hour or so and then retired to let infantry have a go at him Jacko launched attack about 9 am terrific shell fire he launched att 3 times and was repulsed each time Jacko had two companies wiped out retired about sundown We are being relieved by
Entry.326: Still on the way in motor & horse treated very well in clearing station Left in Hos train Arrived at 14 AGH 9 in the evening record trip 3 days
Entry.327: Had bullet taken out very quiet here after front line hope I am not here long
Entry.328: Usual Hospital routine plenty of mates here very busy visiting
Entry.331: Had trip to Cairo very quiet at present
Entry.332:
Red cross trip to Pyramids an enjoyable afternoon had Tea at Mena

arrived home 6.30
Entry.333: Hospital very quiet Aus mail in
Entry.337: Hospital received letters & cards not feeling too good slight touch of malaria Rec Nelly Photo Slight rain
Entry.338: Malaria in full swing out to bed not feeling up to the mark
Entry.339: Still in bed feeling better attack did not last long
Entry.340: Hospital pay day Large sum of 10/-
Entry.341: Hospital Getting ready for Xmas decorations
Entry.342: Hospital decorating a treat ward looking very well
Entry.344: Concert by staff 14th Hospital Decorating finished ward looks OK
Entry.345:
Beautiful day Xmas box RC. Razor & Brush Nuts Cigs Lollies etc

Fine dinner and tea supplied by Sisters had a great time
Entry.346: Saw Doctor and got discharge either go out to morrow or next day Heartily sick of Hospital
Entry.347: Getting discharge today leaving Hospital in the morning Boat leaving for Australia tomorrow Wish I was going
Entry.351: Discharged to day proceeding to P. Said Rest Camp for 14 days
Entry.352: Port Said having a good time town very lively
Entry.353: Port Said Applied for leave to Cairo
